s0091: General Huo originally lived in Pingyang, from the Yan region.
s0092: When I was a gentleman attendant, I met the fangshi Kao Gong under the banner pavilion, and he told me this.
s1: Genealogical Tables of the Three Dynasties
s94: Duke Zhou Gongdan of Lu, King Wu's younger brother. Initial enfeoffment.
s95: Duke Tai Jiang Shang of Qi, teacher of King Wen and King Wu. Initial enfeoffment.
s96: Uncle Tang Shu Yu of Jin, King Wu's son. Initial enfeoffment.
s97: Qin E Lai, assisted Zhou. Father Fei Lian, who was strong.
s98: Chu Xiong Xi. Xi's father Yu Xiong served King Wen. Initial enfeoffment.
s99: Song Wei Zi Qi, Zhou's younger half-brother. Initial enfeoffment.
s100: Kang Shu of Wei, King Wu's younger brother. Initial enfeoffment.
s101: Duke Hu Man of Chen, descendant of Shun. Initial enfeoffment.
s102: Shu Chu of Cai, King Wu's younger brother. Initial enfeoffment.
s103: Shu Zhen Duo of Cao, King Wu's younger brother. Initial enfeoffment.
s104: Duke Zhao Shi of Yan, Zhou same surname. Initial enfeoffment.
s128: Duke Yang, younger brother of Duke Kao.
s144: Duke Min, younger brother of Duke Ding.
s155: Duke Yang, younger brother of Duke Min.
s170: Duke Xian, younger brother of Duke Li.
s182: Marquis Wu, younger brother of Duke Zhen.
